post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
How cool is that, I can follow myself. Now I will never forget what I was posting
Don't forget to donate to keep this project alive: https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/help_zeronet/donate/

I finally got ZeroNet running on my Raspberry Pi and can access it from any device on my wifi now. I guess I am one of the first mobile users :)

Here is how:

*On your Pi*

sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pip
sudo pip install gevent --upgrade
sudo pip install msgpack-python --upgrade

wget https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/archive/master.tar.gz

tar -xzvf master.tar.gz
cd ZeroNet-master
python zeronet.py --ui_ip YOUR_RASPBERRYPI_IP_ADDRESS

*On mobile or PC*

open http://YOUR_RASPBERRYPI_IP_ADDRESS:43110/

ZeroNet needs to get optimised for mobile screens. In chrome for android it does not work at all and I am writing this text in Firefox right now. The reply button for comments and the edit button are not visible.
Are there any ZeroNet sites for ebook torrents?

Being on ZeroNet is like watching the birth of a star.

New interesting, inspiring people every day. It's been ages since I was so occupied with a social network.
Is it possible to have a search function on a ZeroBlog? Or clone the ZeroTorrent site design? Forgive me, I only know a little bit about python and html, the rest I still need to learn
Can anyone advise me on the size limits allowed for a zite? I made a site with roughly 700MB and am still figuring out how to add it to ZeroNet...
How can I change the name that appears for my site on ZeroHello? Currently it only shows the site address :(
@Nofish: I would appreciate it if there was an option to get notified once someone replies to a post to which I replied earlier (currently I only get notified when someone quotes me with @name).
Can anyone access http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtFS31Q11swyo1zWLmyxZRafBSbu86SeL
Is there any way to forward ZeroNet to a port other than 15441? I cannot use it for some reason :(
Is there a size limit on the content.json file? If yes, how can I override it? It is a pain to get a site published, this really needs to become easier.

ZeroLeaks |Bringing you the Snowden files| is up and running: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

Click on the images to open the pdfs (and be patient, there are 545 of them). 

Please share the love and help seeding :)
If there are any people who have purchased an Ubuntu phone, what are your thoughts on it?

**ZeroLeaks has been updated** 

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

*New SIDtoday section.* 

From [The Intercept]("https://theintercept.com/snowden-sidtoday/"):

SIDtoday is the internal newsletter for the NSA’s most important division, the Signals Intelligence Directorate. After editorial review, The Intercept is releasing nine years’ worth of newsletters in batches, starting with 2003. The agency’s spies explain a surprising amount about what they were doing, how they were doing it, and why.
Updated the site design on ZeroLeakz, let me know what you think :) http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

Please recommend me some Jazz gems. 

My suggestion for you: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_BlHRPXPx-4

@Nofish, I would appreciate if you could turn off the "Hello ZeroMe!" notification whenever someone new joins ZeroMe or give me the ability to hide it. Now I am happy whenever someone joins, but it is cluttering my wall. You could display the latest new users on the left hand side of the screen instead or just drop the feature.

Hi guys, @Talnicrom: does some great work on #ZeroMePlus with adding new features to ZeroMe : Hashtags, blocking, reverse comment order and more.  Please check out ZeroMePlus on: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Lj1oPcN7oZQL8HkS5KbkzQuKqs42zQWY6/
Is there any way to find out whether an ebook has watermarking?
Everyone is losing their minds about IPFS - are some file sharing sites already using it? Is it safer than P2P?
The picture upload feature here could include an EXIF stripper ;)
Fixed some page formatting on ZeroLeaks to improve the usability a little bit. http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/
Is it possible to run zeronet through a socks5 proxy (with username and password)? Not TOR, I know how that works.
Does anyone know some good Spanish kodi addons?
Can anyone tell me the difference in yearly power consumption between an external SSD and external HDD if I ran it 24 hours a day?  I would like to expand my storage for ZeroNet...
If you need a VPN: https://thatoneprivacysite.net/simple-vpn-comparison-chart/
Learn more about privacy here: https://www.privacytools.io/ and https://prism-break.org/

For the 5% of you who haven't read it yet :) 

[magnet link](
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:5ad553e9c6e79e4705afad736c376fcb86e2ec7d&dn=George+Orwell+-+1984+%28Nineteen+Eighty-Four%29+%5B1949%5D+%5BEPUB-MOBI-PD&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fpublic.popcorn-tracker.org%3A6969)
Most promising torrent search engines: https://torrentproject.se/ and https://alphareign.se/

['Anonymized' User Data Not Really Anonymous](https://www.techdirt.com/articles/20170123/08125136548/one-more-time-with-feeling-anonymized-user-data-not-really-anonymous.shtml)

 "The programs were able to find patterns among the different groups of data and use those patterns to identify users. The researchers note that the method is not perfect, and it requires a social media feed that includes a number of links to outside sites. However, they said that "given a history with 30 links originating from Twitter, we can deduce the corresponding Twitter profile more than 50 percent of the time."

The researchers had even greater success in an experiment they ran involving 374 volunteers who submitted web browsing information. The researchers were able to identify more than 70 percent of those users by comparing their web browsing data to hundreds of millions of public social media feeds.
ZeroLeakZ does now contain links to all Wikileaks torrents: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/

However, currently there are only the torrents. I am not sure if adding several hundreds of gigabytes to a ZeroNet site is a good idea....any opinions/suggestions?
IPFS - if you have used it before, I would like to ask you a few questions.
How can I have two seeders on a blank site that I never published or shared? Does that have to do with using TOR?
Check out this ebook page from @tiamat:  - this is one of the pages I was waiting for [ZeroPub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeropub.bit)
Does anyone know how I can fix my ZeroMail? the send button is greyed out. I had to restore my ZeroNet installation, only copied the json to keep my profile and it stopped working.

**Remove EXIF Metadata from Photos with exiftool** (Linux)

Sometimes, it is a good idea to scrub EXIF metadata from photos before sharing them, and there is no better tool for the job than exiftool. The command below nukes all EXIF metadata in a photo in one fell swoop (replace foo.jpg with the actual file name):

`exiftool -all= foo.jpg`

This command removes EXIF metadata from the specified photo, but what if you need to process multiple photos? Then you can use the following command which cleans all the photos in the current directory:

`for i in *.jpg; do echo "Processing $i"; exiftool -all= "$i"; done`
The Snowden Files on [ZeroLeakz](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/snowden/index.html) do now have an improved search feature.

I wonder if I should stop seeding ZeroTalk, it has become nothing but a fascist cesspool. We need a reddit-like site with votes and topics, so that the Hitlers can chat in their own subreddit or be downvoted into oblivion. I am fed up of seeing this crap on my news feed all day.
If you are looking for an easy way to implement a search feature on your html site, check out this tutorial: https://www.w3schools.com/w3js/w3js_filters.asp

China’s New Tool for Social Control: A Credit Rating for Everything
Beijing wants to give every citizen a score based on behavior such as spending habits, turnstile violations and filial piety, which can blacklist citizens from loans, jobs, air travel

Chinese users, if you want to learn more about your governments plans click here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/other/ChinaSocialCreditRating.zip
Q: What is the difference between a terrorist training camp and a hospital?
Updated: [Prism-Break Mirror](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Br4MT7PgsRET2APJkbhqqoxwL1CqcCFxh)

This is where I see ZeroNet's potential - long term open source peer to peer technology will eat Twitter, [because its very design enforces the safety of political activists, not the lawyers.](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2017/04/twitter-fights-effort-customs-and-border-protection-identify-administration-critic)

The other day I read about the widely hyped [Mastodon](http://www.theverge.com/2017/4/4/15177856/mastodon-social-network-twitter-clone), a P2P* Twitter clone - I considered signing up [on the hub for security minded people](https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/blob/master/docs/Using-Mastodon/List-of-Mastodon-instances.md), but then I read their [terms](https://securitymastod.one/terms) - **"Information security enthusiasts and pros" will record your email and IP addresses**.  

Why do I get worried if a social network consists of private servers hosted by "security experts" who are keeping logs of IP addresses and emails? 

(edit) *federated not P2P
[TIL America has beautiful weapons](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q4n3SI81m9w)

Dual Boot may be the answer, so you can slowly wean yourself off. Or run it in a virtual machine if you are not gaming...with good hardware you can even use Photoshop in a W7 VM. Check out Antergos, it's easy enough for new Linux users and brings you a rolling release cycle as it is based off arch. No painful re-installations for new OS versions anymore and bleeding edge software. If you want to use the latest features of desktop environments like Gnome or KDE for a vanilla feeling with minimal bloatware, don't use Ubuntu or its derivatives like mint

Please don't feel offended, but alone the slogan "the most trusted messenger in the world" exposes Wickr as bullsh*t. It is closed source, commercial and American and therefore cannot be trusted - there are much better alternatives, e.g. Signal or Antox https://www.eff.org/node/82654

@Sirenyc: Yes - for several reasons: it is open source (makes it harder to hide subpoena-mandated backdoors), was audited (https://threatpost.com/signal-audit-reveals-protocol-cryptographically-sound/121892/), is not saving meta-data (http://www.theregister.co.uk/2016/10/04/whisper_systems_signal_subpoena/), WhatsApp's encryption is based on it (however Whatsapp is not as safe, read https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/139493/is-signal-still-more-secure-than-whatsapp) and last but not least it is Snowden's favourite messaging app.
@Fractal: I would like to use the socks5 offered by a VPN service. I know openVPN but with the current setup it won't work...

@Rythyrix: @FraYoshi: yeehaw :D

@Nofish: This is the page: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Br4MT7PgsRET2APJkbhqqoxwL1CqcCFxh/en/index.html - for every of the 26 languages there is one individual folder with small but many files.

First I tried making everything apart from English optional but still this generates a content.json which is 1.7 MB large as everything gets indexed. 

I wonder if it is possible to e.g. create one language_x.json per subfolder, which indexes that subfolder's contents, so that in the main content.json I can then:

1. "include" the language_x.json files and 
2. "ignore" the data that is already indexed by language_x.json files

Ideally, this would result in 1 content.json and optional 26 language_x.json files with optional content and the page could be served quickly.

I really hope there is a way to do that - obviously this is something that affects many site hosts.
Nice :)

@Nofish: Do you have any idea how to achieve that? I know about the wiki and the option to include additional .json files, but how could I format these compared to the main content.json file (they should only include a list of optional files)?

@Nofish: Hi, first of all thank you very much for implementing this feature. If I zip each language in a separate file and access the page in en.zip, then click on a link that should take me to the Spanish page inside es.zip for example - would I need to change the links inside the index(en).html so that they point to the content inside the es.zip? As they are quite a few links, that would prove difficult - I may have to put everything inside the same zip if that was true...

You can click the publish button several times to that the updates get pushed out quicker to your peers (if there are many).

@tiamat: antilibrary is only non-fiction at the moment. I believe technically it is possible to upload user generated content on zeronet, I mean we can post pictures and also look at the torrent sites!

@Kaffie: I guess removing the cloning feature from the GUI would help. If someone is willing to create a quality content and maintain it, then they will put effort in it and read the wiki, build a page from scratch or at least copy from the folder of another page. A missing GUI option will never stop a dedicated user, but a learning curve can be a  "child safe" to stop the noobs from spamming the network.
@Kaffie: then we possibly need an index where people can submit their sites, tag them and the sites are then ranked by seeders and the date when they were last modified.

Nice work :) I can help you add more English ebooks if you like. Plus as a future feature tagging would be nice - I wonder if the data (e.g. genre) could be pulled from goodreads? It is possible to search by isbn, so I could try to webscrape data with python so you can put it on the page if you have the isbns

Let's hope he didn't get stuck in the airport :(
@Plasmmer: Actually I prefer epub, all other pages have only pdf which is a pain to read on ebook readers.
@Plasmmer: When taking a picture, a camera often writes metadata into the file and in some cases even your GPS location.
@Yinyue: Is it true that the Japanese are not liked by a lot of people in Asia?

@Yinyue: In the West the Hollywood action movies nearly always depict the Russians, Middle-Easterners or sometimes Chinese as evil guys - according to the current political agenda. For example it is so surreal to watch Rambo's 80s movies with Taliban as "freedom fighters". You can even find that pattern in computer games like Call of Duty. What never changes, is that the Americans are the spotless saviours. Often the critical media does not get enough attention and drowns in the noise of celebrity news and fear of terrorism.

@Yinyue: I am interested in life in China - I read your government has plans to use big data (e.g. browsing histories, social media posts) to give citizens ratings, which then decide whether you get a credit or can travel to another country. Is that true? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_Credit_System
@Yinyue: Also, how many young people in China know about VPN/ TOR? Do only a few nerds escape the bubble?

@Yinyue: Is VPN/TOR/ZeroNet something you would discuss with friends or do you need to be careful when talking about such topics? My parents used to live in a totalitarian state and there were many secret informants who would report their "friends" to the authorities.

@Yinyue: I am afraid that the West is slowly moving towards a similar system - governments here use the fear of terrorism to legalise laws that allow them to record your browsing behaviour. Also they are talking about breaking encryption/building backdoors. Once they notice that more people start using VPN/TOR to protect their privacy, they will find a terrorist that uses this software and ban it, too.

10 years ago people here said that only dictatures like China surveill the internet. You were called paranoid if you said that the USA would do it too. Thanks to Snowden we all know it but everyone shrugs their shoulders. No protests. People here are too lazy, passive and uninterested - as long as they do not ban fast food, football, cars, beer and iPhones no one will care.
@Kskarthik: there is an upvote, but no downvote option. ZeroMe hubs are centralised, but you can run your own. ZeroNet sites are decentralised and hosted by the users.
Nooo :(
@K9: a database of the pirate bay, kat, isohunt and so on
I was thinking that Zerotorrent is a bit sparse...but I also have my doubts that a ZeroNet page could support a database as big as the pirate bay....

As was suggested, maybe you should do your promo talk anyways and put it on youtube. Did they give any specific reason for why they cancelled (apart from blabla right time, I mean why did they contact you in the first place?) 

TED are possibly worried about something that could negatively affect their image. My theories:

1. Is it the bunch fascists/homophobes/antisemites on the promoted ZeroTalk  site who would totally screw ZeroNets (and TED's) image? I mean everyone who visits ZeroNet for the first time goes to the default sites first, and if they see some nazi crap right on the first page they may just leave without digging deeper.
